title: typewriter touch fonts
content:
hey everyone  
i’m looking for a font with a typewriter touch, like american typewriter or courrier or serifa for example.  
do you have other references in mind?  
thanx a lot (as usual)…

 [‹ Table of Contents middots](http://web.archive.org/web/20080907014536/http:/www.typophile.com/node/45046 "Go to previous forum topic") [Anyone know this Badge logo? ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080907014536/http:/www.typophile.com/node/45068 "Go to next forum topic")
author: drduckling

comments.content:
You should visit this swiss foundry’s website —-\> [http://www.lineto.com/](http://web.archive.org/web/20080907014536/http:/www.lineto.com/ "http://www.lineto.com/") as they have a few nice typewriter flavoured fonts. Optimo has “Editor”, have a look here —-\> [http://optimo.ch/pages/departement/index.php?id\_categorie=1&id\_font=13](http://web.archive.org/web/20080907014536/http:/optimo.ch/pages/departement/index.php?id_categorie=1&id_font=13 "http://optimo.ch/pages/departement/index.php?id\_categorie=1&id\_font=13")  
Not another foundry, just an interesting article entitled “Typewriter Typefaces” I read recently —-\> [http://blogs.walkerart.org/design/2008/03/23/typewriter-typefaces/](http://web.archive.org/web/20080907014536/http:/blogs.walkerart.org/design/2008/03/23/typewriter-typefaces/ "http://blogs.walkerart.org/design/2008/03/23/typewriter-typefaces/")
thk u ! i’m checking it out right now

\<shameless selfpromotion\>  
If you are looking for that distressed typewriter look, check out my reworked [Kingthings Trypewriter Pro](http://web.archive.org/web/20080907014536/http:/www.cheapprofonts.com/Kingthings_Trypewriter_Pro) originally made by Keving King. This Pro version have a large multilingual character set and is properly monospaced :)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080907014536im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/Kingthings_Trypewriter_Pro_200_4710.gif)

\</shameless selfpromotion\>  
;)
